channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Illegal Posters, 6th August
item.description:
On Midfield Way at the junction with Sevenoaks Way, St Paul’s Cray, Orpington: Please could you remove several illegal posters advertising an event in Gran Canaria, Spain, which are fixed to the Council’s lighting and street sign columns.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 2, Midfield Way, St Paul's Cray, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Litter left on geldeston road, 6th August
item.description:
Rubbish left here for over 3 days it’s appalling how much litter is being dumped in the street

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Geldeston Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dumped Items, 6th August
item.description:
On Cotmandene Crescent at the junction with Rushet Road, St Paul’s Cray, Orpington: Please could you remove two dumped yellow roadwork barriers from the grass verge.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 88-90, Cotmandene Crescent, St Paul's Cray, Orpington, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Crack and dip in Road surface, 5th August
item.description:
This issue was reported by someone else around beginning of July. Someone has been out to see the issue as spray markings are on each corner of the subsidence a couple of weeks ago at least. However when I looked on here to check progress the report has now gone. Can you please update when repairs will happen as I worry every time I along with other car drivers I know worry when we have to drive over the area daily. Thanks.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 63, Haslemere Road, Barnehurst, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Illegal Posters, 5th August
item.description:
On North Cray Road at the junction with Water Lane, Sidcup/Bexley: Please could you remove two illegal plumbing advertisement posters fixed to wood pallets on the pavement.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): North Cray Road, North Cray, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fly-tipping – bin bags dumped on stairs, ripped by foxes, causing serious mess and hygiene issue, 5th August
item.description:
Household bin bags are being left on the communal staircase instead of disposed of correctly. These bags are repeatedly torn open by foxes, spreading food waste and rubbish across the steps. This has resulted in a significant accumulation of waste, strong odours, and an infestation of flies. One side of the staircase has become unusable, restricting safe access for residents. This issue is ongoing and cannot be dismissed as a one-off occurrence. It constitutes a serious environmental health risk, attracting vermin and insects, and creating hazardous conditions in a shared residential space. It also poses a potential fire and safety hazard by obstructing a primary access route.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Elmdene Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dumped Item, 5th August
item.description:
Outside the Porsche dealership on Edgington Way, Foots Cray, Sidcup: There is a large cardboard box on the pavement which has been sitting there for over two weeks. Please could you remove it.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Edgington Way, St Paul's Cray, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: By the road going into the old police station, 5th August
item.description:
The drop curb has not been put in correctly. It is at an angle so it is hazardous and narrow when using a mobility scooter. The angle can tip the user off their vehicle
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 51, Downshire Hill, Belsize Park, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rats in the park, 5th August
item.description:
I saw two rats today in the park. Opposite the litter bin, behind the orange life boy. They were too quick for me to photograph. They were on the edge of the lake, down in the brambles. Thanks.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): The Chase, Widmore, London
